post_text:
Picture Day 2 is this Friday, September 18th.
To reduce touch-points this year we have eliminated the traditional Picture Day order form.

To place your order online go to: orders.christmascitystudio.com
Enter School Code: BWHTSHS20

All portrait packages will be shipped directly to you.
Go here information on our new Covid-Safe Picture Day Procedures. https://www.christmascitystudio.com/fallpictures
Bring your smiles Friday! We're looking forward to seeing your smiling faces this year more than ever!

-From the team at Christmas City Studio
Christmas City Studio -
orders.christmascitystudio.com

Thanks!

post_text: Up next is Zack Moyer! Zack will be attending RACC in the fall studying Computer Technology. He will graduate with his Associate Degree in Spring 2021 and plans to pursue his Bachelor of Science degree at Penn State University. During his High School career, Zack attended BCTC and served as Skills USA Leadership VP. He was also involved with FBLA and played on the swim, soccer and volleyball teams. Congratulations on all you have accomplished! Keep reaching for your goals and stay true to the awesome human being you are!

post_text: Next we have senior Meghan Allmendinger. Meghan will be attending the University of Connecticut this fall majoring in Maritime Studies with a minor in Maritime Archaeology. She has been involved with Concert band and Jazz band for the past four years, played in various Berks County Sr. Band and Orchestra concerts, is a member of the Tennis team, and is a certified diver and has obtained certifications in Advance Open Water, Nitrox and Drysuit. In addition, she plans to join the scuba club at UCONN. Congratulations, Meghan!

post_text:
Good Morning All,

On behalf of myself, Mr. Barnhart, and the faculty and staff here at Brandywine Heights High School, I want to wish you and your families a relaxing and restful Winter Break. Please be safe in your travels if you are doing so, and enjoy the time off. As we find ourselves nearing the halfway point of the year, we just want to say how proud we are of all of the accomplishments made by our students in their classrooms, as well as in our community. We are continually thankful for and appreciate the opportunity to work with our students and their families each and every day. We look forward to the rest of the year with our students and are excited about everything that 2020 will bring to the High School.

We hope that you have an enjoyable holiday season with your family and friends, and we will see you in the new year when we return on Thursday, January the 2nd.

Thank you again for all of your support. Have a great day, a lovely break, and a happy, healthy start to the new year.

post_text:
Good Afternoon Brandywine Heights High School Families,

As we have just begun our fall break, I wanted to take a quick moment to express our gratitude and thanks to you for the opportunity to work with your children every day. It is hard to believe that we are approaching December already, and our school year is moving so quickly. On behalf of myself, Mr. Barnhart, and the entire staff and faculty here at Brandywine Heights High School, I want to wish you a relaxing and restful fall break. Please travel safely, enjoy your time with friends and loved ones, and know that we are so very proud and thankful for all of our students here. We will see you on Tuesday, December 3rd when we resume school. Have a great day.

Please travel safely, enjoy your time with friends and loved ones, and know that we are so very proud and thankful for all of our students here. We will see you on Tuesday, December 3rd when we resume school. Have a great day.

post_text:
ATTENTION SENIORS!
The deadline to have senior portraits turned in for the yearbook is Wednesday, November 21st, 2018. If you do not meet the deadline, then the yearbook staff will use your portrait taken on picture day in the yearbook instead of whatever pictures you get taken outside of school. Pictures must be sent to Miss Day digitally (maeday@bhasd.org); hard copies will not be accepted. The photos must also be 300 dpi (dots-per-inch) or higher in order to be accepted. You may use school appropriate props in pictures, but that will be at you and your photographer’s discretion. BHHS DOES NOT PROVIDE PROPS FOR YOU OR A PHOTOGRAPHER!
Baby pictures will be due digitally to Miss Day on Wednesday, November 21st, 2018 as well. Be sure to send your name with your baby picture so that we know who it is!

Pictures must be sent to Miss Day digitally (maeday@bhasd.org); hard copies will not be accepted. The photos must also be 300 dpi (dots-per-inch) or higher in order to be accepted. You may use school appropriate props in pictures, but that will be at you and your photographer’s discretion. BHHS DOES NOT PROVIDE PROPS FOR YOU OR A PHOTOGRAPHER!
Baby pictures will be due digitally to Miss Day on Wednesday, November 21st, 2018 as well. Be sure to send your name with your baby picture so that we know who it is!

post_text:
The video below is from the High School Art Department's Memory Project. Our students sent portraits to Russian, Afghanistan, Syria, Haiti, and Mexico; as well as donations for art supplies.

A Russian newspaper covered this story and titled it "From America with Love." It began, "At the height of the political crisis, these portraits of kindness flew to Russia with the most kind wishes from across the ocean." They went on to call this a "remarkable example of people's diplomacy," and that is thanks to each of you. You've exemplified the art of diplomacy in your thoughtful and caring actions. You've helped to show that with great tension between our countries our youth can still share joy and see themselves in one another.

Please take a few minutes to enjoy this video.

https://drive.google.com/file/d/1ygRlfbIA4hJ_t8UMO502zJPIm79wqaLn/view?usp=sharing

They went on to call this a "remarkable example of people's diplomacy," and that is thanks to each of you. You've exemplified the art of diplomacy in your thoughtful and caring actions. Andrew Potteiger

Good Evening,

This is a message from the Brandywine Heights Area School District. To help families prepare for tomorrow morning I wanted to send a message out this evening with an update on the status of school tomorrow. The School District will be operating under a two hour delay for tomorrow, Thursday, March 22nd. With the uncertainty of what the roads conditions are going to be in the morning, the delay will help determine if it is safe for busses to travel. If there would be a need to change the status of school after evaluating conditions, any additional calls will be made by 7:30 AM.

Andrew Potteiger
Superintendent

post_text:
The High School Art Club has been participating in The Memory Project for the past two years.

"The Memory Project is a charitable nonprofit organization that invites art teachers and their students to create and donate portraits to youth around the world who have faced substantial challenges, such as neglect, abuse, loss of parents, violence, and extreme poverty."

Please check out the two videos from Syria and Ukraine. Our students have worked extremely hard and our proud of their efforts to place a smile on a little child's face!

Thank you Dr, Graham and Ms. Sweitzer for organizing such a meaningful and touching experience for our students.

https://drive.google.com/a/bhasd.org/file/d/0BwYYNFYwgcbqb1g0VVZHZVdMU2M/view?usp=sharing

https://drive.google.com/file/d/0BwYYNFYwgcbqZnFfLU5xclBrZEU/view?ts=58f9f976

post_text: Long trip home but we are arriving at Brandywine now. Thank you to Mr. Potteiger and our board members for allowing our students to have such a wonderful experience they will never forget.
text: Long trip home but we are arriving at Brandywine now. Thank you to Mr. Potteiger and our board members for allowing our students to have such a wonderful experience they will never forget.

post_text: We have safely landed in the states from our fantastic Italy trip!
text: We have safely landed in the states from our fantastic Italy trip!

post_text:
What a wonderful experience Dr. Graham gave our students. They represented Brandywine with class and respect.
The art work, architect, ruins, culture, customs, and food were beyond words could express. Our students will talk about Italy 🇮🇹 for years to come. Dr. Graham we all want to say THANK YOU for all your hard work in planning this trip and being such a positive role model and teacher to our students. The arts are alive in us and our district. 🎨

post_text: Students had a wonderful day in Rome! We visited the Vatican today. Unbelievable how large and exquisite it is.
text: Students had a wonderful day in Rome! We visited the Vatican today. Unbelievable how large and exquisite it is.

post_text: First day in Rome. We visited the Colosseum and the Roman Forum.
text: First day in Rome. We visited the Colosseum and the Roman Forum.

post_text: Day 2 in Florence. Our students are having a fantastic time. Today we visited the Accademia and the Uffizi! The groups also went out on their own to explore and shop.
text: Day 2 in Florence. Our students are having a fantastic time. Today we visited the Accademia and the Uffizi! The groups also went out on their own to explore and shop.

post_text: Ending our day one in Florence. It rained but that didn't stop us.
text: Ending our day one in Florence. It rained but that didn't stop us.

post_text: In Florence and having a blast.
text: In Florence and having a blast.

post_text: A fantastic day in Venice! It's beautiful here.
text: A fantastic day in Venice! It's beautiful here.

post_text: Glass blowing and now a Ferry Ride into Venice!
text: Glass blowing and now a Ferry Ride into Venice!

post_text: We have safely landed and now a bit of a layover to our destination! 🇮🇹

post_text: To all our students traveling to Italy...as Dr. Graham stated "Ci vediamo Venerdi [I'll see you Friday!!!] @ 7:30!

post_text: What a great night at Vaudeville! Congratulations to all the great performances. Our winners were: Saxy Saxes: Amanda Bunn, Kasey Hobert, Robert Lichtenwalner, Kolby Smith, Lydia Freeby; Khalsa Kjarlar Kollmar & Alayna Biltcluff; Paige Fenstermacher; and Kjalar Kollmar!

post_text: Thank you to all the students, staff, and community members who joined in Brandywine's mini thon. We exceeded our goal! Great Job!!!!

post_text: Come join us tonight!

post_text:
Good Evening,

This is a message from the Brandywine Heights Area School District. To help families prepare for tomorrow morning I wanted to send a message out this evening with an update on the status of school tomorrow. The School District will be operating under a two hour delay for tomorrow, Friday, February 10th. The strong winds and cold caused drifting and black ice in areas. A two hour delay will allow additional time for roads to be treated where necessary and a safer travel in daylight.

Please stay safe and warm this evening,

Andrew Potteiger

post_text:
Good Morning

This is a message from the Brandywine Heights Area School District. The District will be CLOSED today due to the current storm in place which brought snow last night and the forecast for it to continue throughout the day today. All offices will also be closed today.

Thank you

Andrew Potteiger

Superintendent

post_text:
Good Evening,

This is a message from the Brandywine Heights Area School District. To help families prepare for tomorrow morning I wanted to send a message out this evening with an update on the status of school tomorrow. With the anticipation of the upcoming storm, the School District will be operating under a two hour delay for tomorrow, Thursday, February 9th. The delay will help determine the impact of the storm tomorrow morning. We are going to closely evaluate the event and any additional calls will be made by 7:30 AM.

Thank you and have a nice evening

Andrew Potteiger
Superintendent
